name: BookPeople
description: Texas's largest independent bookstore with extensive selection, author events, and a beloved community gathering space.
longDescription: BookPeople is more than Austin's premier bookstore—it's a cultural institution. Spanning multiple floors on North Lamar, this fiercely independent bookstore stocks an incredible range of titles, from bestsellers to rare finds. The staff recommendations are genuinely excellent, and the author event calendar brings literary luminaries to Austin regularly. The children's section is one of the best anywhere, and the local interest section celebrates Texas and Austin culture. In a city that prides itself on keeping things local, BookPeople is a shining example.

name: Allen's Boots
description: Iconic South Congress boot shop with thousands of pairs of cowboy boots and authentic Texas style.
longDescription: Allen's Boots is a South Congress Avenue landmark and a temple to Texas boot culture. Thousands of pairs of cowboy boots line the walls—from classic work boots to exotic skins to custom designs costing thousands. The staff knows boots inside and out and will help you find the perfect fit and style. Whether you're buying your first pair or your twentieth, the experience of shopping here feels distinctly Texan. The neon sign is one of the most photographed spots on South Congress.
tips: Great photo op with neon sign
Prices range from affordable to luxury

name: Uncommon Objects
description: Sprawling South Congress antique mall with eclectic treasures, vintage finds, and oddities from multiple dealers.
longDescription: Uncommon Objects is an antique lover's wonderland on South Congress Avenue. This sprawling space houses dozens of dealers, each curating their own eclectic collection of vintage finds, antiques, oddities, and collectibles. You might find vintage taxidermy next to mid-century modern furniture, antique jewelry beside old neon signs. The treasure-hunt atmosphere rewards patient browsing, and the diversity of items means you'll discover something unexpected every visit. It's quintessentially Austin—weird, wonderful, and one of a kind.

name: South Congress Avenue Shopping
description: Austin's most iconic shopping strip with boutiques, vintage shops, and local businesses lining the famous SoCo avenue.
longDescription: South Congress Avenue—SoCo to locals—is Austin's most walkable and iconic shopping district. The stretch from Barton Springs Road south is lined with independently owned boutiques, vintage shops, galleries, and restaurants that collectively define Austin's aesthetic. From Lucy in Disguise costume shop to Parts & Labour vintage, from Stag menswear to Tesoros Trading Company, each store reflects Austin's creative, independent spirit. First Thursdays bring extra energy with extended hours and special events. The avenue also offers prime views of the State Capitol.
tips: Walk both sides of the street
Parking can be challenging on weekends

name: Domain Northside
description: Upscale outdoor shopping destination in North Austin with luxury brands, dining, and entertainment.
longDescription: Domain Northside is Austin's premier luxury shopping and lifestyle destination. This beautifully designed outdoor shopping center in North Austin features high-end retailers like Nordstrom, Louis Vuitton, and Tiffany & Co. alongside popular brands and excellent restaurants. The walkable, European-inspired design creates a pleasant shopping experience year-round. Dining options range from casual to upscale, and the entertainment venues keep the area lively into the evening. For those relocating to Austin from cities like New York or San Francisco, Domain offers familiar luxury retail in a Texas setting.
tips: Park in the garage for shade

name: 2nd Street District
description: Downtown Austin shopping district with boutiques, restaurants, and urban living steps from Lady Bird Lake.
longDescription: The 2nd Street District brings sophisticated urban retail to downtown Austin, just blocks from Lady Bird Lake. This mixed-use district features carefully curated boutiques, popular restaurants, and specialty shops in a walkable, tree-lined setting. Retailers include local favorites alongside national brands, and the proximity to the lake trail makes it easy to combine shopping with outdoor activity. The district captures downtown Austin's evolution into a vibrant live-work-play environment.
address: 200 block of W 2nd St, Austin, TX 78701
tips: Walk to Lady Bird Lake after

name: Waterloo Records
description: Austin's legendary independent record store with massive vinyl selection, in-store performances, and music expertise.
longDescription: Waterloo Records is the beating heart of Austin's music retail scene. This independent record store on North Lamar stocks an enormous selection of vinyl, CDs, and music memorabilia, with a staff that possesses encyclopedic music knowledge. In-store performances by major and emerging artists happen regularly—it's common to see Grammy winners playing acoustic sets for a crowd of fifty. The local music section is the best place to discover Austin's incredible music scene, and the used vinyl bins are a treasure trove for collectors.

name: Tesoros Trading Company
description: Colorful South Congress shop with Mexican folk art, handcrafted goods, and Latin American treasures.
longDescription: Tesoros Trading Company is a riot of color and craft on South Congress Avenue. This beloved shop specializes in Mexican folk art, handcrafted goods, and treasures from across Latin America. From intricately painted Oaxacan wood carvings to Dia de los Muertos art, from handwoven textiles to Talavera pottery, the shop is a feast for the eyes. The owners travel extensively to source directly from artisans, ensuring authenticity and fair trade. It's the perfect place for unique, meaningful gifts or to add vibrant character to your home.

name: Feathers Boutique Vintage
description: Curated vintage clothing boutique on South Congress with designer pieces, retro fashion, and Austin style.
longDescription: Feathers Boutique Vintage has been a South Congress institution for decades, curating an impeccable collection of vintage clothing from every era. The racks are organized by decade, making it easy to find your preferred style, whether that's 1970s bohemian, 1980s power dressing, or 1950s rockabilly. The quality is high—this isn't a thrift store but a carefully curated vintage experience. The owners have an exceptional eye for pieces that feel current despite their age. It's where Austin's most stylish people shop.

name: Barton Creek Square
description: Major Austin shopping mall with department stores, specialty retailers, and family-friendly amenities.
longDescription: Barton Creek Square is Austin's primary enclosed shopping mall, anchored by major department stores and featuring over 150 specialty retailers. Located in the desirable West Austin area near the Barton Creek Greenbelt, the mall serves as a convenient one-stop shopping destination. The retail mix includes fashion, electronics, home goods, and specialty shops. The food court and sit-down restaurants provide dining options, and the central location makes it accessible from most Austin neighborhoods.
address: 2901 S Capital of Texas Hwy, Austin, TX 78746

name: East Austin Maker Market
description: Rotating artisan marketplace showcasing East Austin's creative community with handmade goods, art, and local crafts.
longDescription: The East Austin Maker Market celebrates the neighborhood's creative spirit through rotating pop-up events and permanent retail spaces. Local artisans sell handmade goods ranging from jewelry and ceramics to leather goods and prints. The markets often coincide with East Austin Studio Tour events, creating a festival atmosphere. It's the best way to discover emerging Austin makers and take home something truly handmade and local.
tips: East Austin Studio Tour is big

name: Whole Earth Provision Co.
description: Austin's beloved outdoor outfitter since 1970 with gear, clothing, and nature-inspired gifts for the active lifestyle.
longDescription: Whole Earth Provision Co. has been outfitting Austin adventurers since 1970. This locally owned store stocks quality outdoor gear, clothing, shoes, and nature-inspired gifts and home goods. The staff are outdoor enthusiasts themselves, offering genuine advice on gear for hiking, camping, kayaking, and all the activities that make Austin's outdoor scene special. The eclectic mix of quality outdoor brands, unique toys, and nature-themed gifts makes it as much fun to browse as to shop with purpose.

name: Tyler's
description: Austin-based clothing store specializing in street and surf style with exclusive releases and local collaborations.
longDescription: Tyler's has grown from a small Austin shop into a regional streetwear destination. Specializing in surf, skate, and street-inspired clothing, the store carries popular brands alongside exclusive collaborations and limited releases. The Austin flagship on Guadalupe (the Drag) near UT is a hub for the younger crowd seeking the latest drops. Multiple Austin locations make it accessible across the city.
